Test Operations Deputy Director in the Standards and Testing Agency (STA). The Division has responsibility for the delivery of assessments and testing in England, under statutory instruments, on behalf of the Secretary of State for Education.  In carrying out these functions, the division
• undertakes operational delivery of national curriculum tests and assessments; 
• supports the process of teacher assessment moderation; and
• supports schools and other stakeholders (by providing guidance, communications and helpdesk support). 
The Division also produces guidance and exemplification materials for the Early Years Foundation Stage Profile, Key Stage 1 and Key Stage 2 English writing teacher assessment and has a statutory function in respect of maladministration – where the validity of test results are in doubt for any reason.The Test Operations division took on responsibility for the general qualifications logistics service, provided to exam centres and examiners, on  1st April 2014

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Head of Central Capital Unit. The Unit manages the Department’s capital budget, and is responsible for capital policy, including ensuring there are sufficient school places, and the condition and maintenance of the education estate

Name: Dugald Sandeman
Job/Team Function: The role of the Maintained Schools Division includes: The collection of financial data for maintained schools; The calculation and payment of funding allocations to local authorities of the Dedicated Schools Grant and the Pupil Premium; Gaining assurance from local authorities of the proper use of the grants for schools paid to them; The implementation of the school funding reforms announced in March 2012 for 2013-14; and the assessment of the appropriate amounts to be recouped from local authorities for expenditure on Academies in their areas.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for the free school application and assessment processes; programme management of the free schools programme including management information, communications and oversight of the Department’s relationship with New Schools Network; and the future development of the free school programme

Name: Tom Shinner
Job/Team Function:
• Advising the Secretary of State, the Permanent Secretary and the DfE board on strategy and policy
• Leading and managing the department’s strategy unit, performance unit, implementation group and policy advisers
• Leading the department’s strategic and financial planning, including overseeing the DfE’s contribution to HM Treasury spending reviews
• Assessing the department’s performance, reporting progress to the board and ministers, and ensuring risk is managed effectively
• Supporting the effective implementation of high-priority initiatives
Unit: Strategy Performance and Private Office Group

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for the policy and implementation of the University Technical College & Studio School Programmes.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: I lead the Academies East Division in Academies Group. I work with two Regional Schools Commissioners: Tim Coulson (East of England and North East London) and Jenny Bexon-Smith (East Midlands and the Humber) and their offices. Academies East Division is responsible in the two regions for: working with schools wanting to convert and brokerage of new sponsored academies; post-approval work to open all academy projects (converters and sponsored); and intervening in under-performing open academies. We also lead on all delivery processes and procedures across the other regional divisions. I lead continuous improvement for the group and jointly at directorate level

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Group Head of Internal Audit

Name: Paul Smith
Job/Team Function: Regional Schools Commissioner for the Lancashire and West Yorkshire: responsible for tackling educational underperformance and inadequate governance in open academies; approving new academy provision; managing the regional sponsor market for academies; and providing advice and taking decisions in relation to free schools, UTCs and studio schools

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The Division is responsible for issues relating to school food, including free school meals.  It is also responsible for post-16 participation in education and training including raising the participation age, young people not in employment, education or training (NEET), careers guidance and post-16 transport

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: My statement on my role is: As a member of the senior leadership of NCTL, I lead the work on teaching schools, system leadership, school improvement and leadership supply

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Deputy Director, Priority School Building Programme

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Deputy Director, Independent Education and School Governance: responsible for policy on the registration and regulation of the independent schools sector in England and taking regulatory action where schools fail to meet the independent school standards.  Also responsible for policy on the governance of maintained schools in England

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function:
The post of Deputy Director for Finance, Programme, Property and Technical in Free Schools Capital is responsible for supervising the:
• Acquisition of temporary and permanent sites for locating schools, and securing appropriate planning consents
• Technical aspects of site inspection, selection, costing, preparation, contractor procurement and construction management
• Structured planning, management and delivery of the programme to ensure fit-for-purpose schools open on time and budget
• Financial management: forecasting costs, operating cost controls, promoting efficiency and value for money, and ensuring affordability within the budget agreed with HM Treasury.

Name: Charlie Taylor
Job/Team Function: The National College for Teaching and Leadership (NCTL) is a new government agency created to enable and support the development of a self-improving, school-led system. The agency was formed from the merger, on 2 April 2013, of the National College for School Leadership and the Teaching Agency. NCTL has two key aims: improving the quality of the education workforce; and helping schools to help each other to improve

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The Due Diligence and Counter Extremism Division (previously known as the Preventing Extremism Unit) was established in October 2010 and was the first counter extremism division in government outside of the Home Office. The Division’s aim is to ensure that children and young people in England are safeguarded from extremists and extremist views in schools or in out of school hours learning, and prevent young people from becoming radicalised or acting on extreme views. The division is comprised of civil servants with support from specialists who have expertise in security matters

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for: project work supporting GCSE reform.
Unit: Childcare, Special Needs and Children’s Services Strategy

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Programme Director – Priority School Building Programme Phase 2

Name: Ian Todd
Job/Team Function: Chief Executive and Accounting Officer for the Standards and Testing Agency, developing and delivering all National Curriculum assessments up to the end of Key Stage 3.  As Chief Executive, responsible for the corporate performance of the STA and for setting its strategic direction in line with Ministerial priorities.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Joint Head of Business Partner division.  Business Partner for the Education Standards Directorate and the corporate centre in DfE, supporting discussion/decision making within the senior management teams. Overview of finances, including, management information on programme and administrative costs, guidance on accounting , propriety/value for money; strategic financial analysis; engagement in the Department’s financial exercises.  Provision of financial services for the NCTL and STA.

Name: Isabelle Trowler
Job/Team Function:
The Chief Social Worker for Children and Families works collaboratively with the Chief Social Worker for Adults. Together they work from the Office of the Chief Social Worker to:
• support and challenge the profession to ensure that children and adults get the best possible help from social workers 
• provide independent expert advice to ministers on social work reform, and the contribution of social work and social workers to policy implementation more generally
• provide leadership and work with key leaders in the profession and wider sector to drive forward the improvement and reform programme for social work
• challenge weak practice to achieve decisive improvements in the quality of social work
• provide leadership to the network of principal social workers
Unit: Childcare, Special Needs and Children’s Services Strategy

Name: Brian Tytherleigh
Job/Team Function: Provide direct support to the Chief Executive of the National College for Teaching and Learning, oversee accountability and performance, and ensure the agency operates and functions as a fully integrated and supportive component of the DfE.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: I lead a number of projects to improve two key components of the childcare system.  Firstly, effective management of the curriculum and regulatory framework that childcare providers need to comply with and be inspected against by Ofsted.  Secondly, the early years and childcare workforce, where we are raising the status and qualifications of the profession, and increasing the ability of providers to improve their staff.  My overall aim is to ensure that children access affordable, high-quality early education and childcare that keeps them safe and enables them to learn and develop so that they are ready to thrive at school.
Unit: Childcare, Special Needs and Children’s Services Strategy

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Deputy Director for Organisational Change and Communications- Leading the HR Programme and strategy for raising capability; engagement strategy with trade unions and staff and internal communications. Also leading the reorganisation of the CIO Group.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Responsible for test development within the Standards and Testing Agency, to ensure that all statutory tests and assessments meet OfQual's common regulatory principles, including validity, reliability and freedom from bias. Also responsible for the development and delivery of the Professional Skills Tests for prospective teachers

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Head of a unit of 17 people advising Ministers on the distribution of the Department’s budget; carrying out longer term strategic thinking; analysing issues that affect the delivery of Ministers’ priorities; and building the policy-making capacity of the Department as proposed in the DfE Review.
Unit: Office of the Schools Commissioner Group

Name: Mela Watts
Job/Team Function: Senior Responsible Officer for the Free Schools, University Technical Colleges & Studio Schools programmes - policy development and implementation and for the work of the Due Diligence and Counter Extremism Division.

Casework on inter-country adoptions and ensuring adoptions into and out of the UK comply with international safeguards.

National lead for EFA on 16 – 18 Apprenticeships and Traineeships. Management of Apprenticeships budget, and programme development.

Name: N/D

The Chief Policy Non-Political Policy Advisor to the Secretary of State. He is responsible for the overall management of the Department and is accountable to Parliament for the actions the Department takes and the way in which taxpayers’ money is spent.

Job/Team Function: Leads Supply Division, which is responsible for policy on initial teacher training and school system leadership and industrial relations.
